para.text: In this section, you will learn how to create components. A component is a custom HTML tag that has its inner markup, styles for this markup, and JavaScript code which defines the behavior of the component. It helps us to create more structured content and allows not to repeat ourselves. Components also provide isolation of styles and JavaScript code.
The main purposes of creating components are:

para.text: Consider the components' usage by the example of the
component. You can add several copies on the same slide. After linking the component to the slide, just add the component tag to the slide markup.
Also, you can insert different HTML-elements inside the components if they allow such behavior. Besides, you can redefine the default
for every component via the model attribute. Since the components are HTML-elements, you can add different CSS classes in order to stylize them.
